channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Slightly out of view traffic, near miss collision, 18th January
item.description:
The traffic light by the Audi garage facing towards Smyths toy store. The traffic light here is dangerous for pedestrians. It turns red for cars coming left from the Tewkesbury Road. However, due to the bend in the road and momentum with which cars drive around it, cars don’t notice the red traffic light at the pedestrian crossing. This morning (18 Jan) at 1025, I waited at the pedestrian light to cross, when it was green for me and red for the cars, 5 cars drove through the light and one did not stop when I walked into the road despite me having right of way. This traffic light is positioned dangerously. Please consider changes or else a fatality will inevitably happen
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Water pouring from public footpath into Bentham Lane, 18th January
item.description:
For the last few weeks there has been a constant flow of water from the public footpath opposite Smiths Barn on to Bentham Lane which is breaking up the road surface as it flows down into Dog Lane. This is a fairly recent phenomenon and may indicate some changes to the topology of the site known locally as ‘the golf course’.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bentham Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Constant stream of water pouring down Dog Lane, 18th January
item.description:
There has been a constant stream of water pouring down Bentham Lane into Dog Lane and then into the drain. The flooding at the junction is a hazard (particularly when it freezes) and is breaking up the road surface.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: This is a very poor repair of a pothole. If you study the picture there have been gouges made in the original surface to which the new tarmac should abut. It does not. No decent compaction or edging resulting in rapid deterioration of repair. Tarmac saving and poor effort. The same has happened with a similar repair up the road. Do you not carry out quality control?!, 18th January
item.description:
Previous repair. You should know where it is

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extensive tagging, 18th January
item.description:
The bus stop is covered in tagging so much that as a customer you cannot see the bus coming. It is figuring and a real eye sore.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tommy Taylors Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Damaged cones littering the verges, 17th January
item.description:
There are numerous fallen and damaged cones dotted along the stretch from Seven Springs to the Withington turn, with most being from Pegglesworth through to the Kilkenny pub. They are just littering the highway and serving no purpose at all. As there are roadworks being undertaken along this road, it's an opportunity to remove them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Black bollard knocked over, 17th January
item.description:

item.category: Complete bollard is damaged (Non illuminating bollard or post)

item.title: Potholes along the stretch of road, 17th January
item.description:
A number of potholes have appeared since the others were reported & they’re getting bigger. My car has been damaged due to cars driving at speed, hitting the loose stones & them hitting my car! Some of the holes has a white mark pur around them ages ago, but the gold are getting bigger and more have appeared between the roundabout, along Unwin road towards Bridgend road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Unwin Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
